meanings.definition: The art or technique of making motion pictures.
meanings.sent1: Learning about cinematographies helps us understand how movies are created.
meanings.sent2: Many people admire the skill involved in cinematographies.
meanings.sent3: The class on cinematographies was so interesting that I didn't want to leave.
meanings.sent4: Her mind was a canvas, and cinematographies painted the most beautiful stories.
meanings.sent5: The magic of cinematographies brings stories to life on the big screen.

meanings.sent1: In Hollywood, many dream of a career in cinematographies.
meanings.sent2: His passion for cinematographies led him to work on various film sets.
meanings.sent3: The director joked that the hardest part of cinematographies was dealing with diva actors.
meanings.sent4: She navigated the world of cinematographies with grace and determination.
meanings.sent5: The bustling studio was filled with the energy of cinematographies in action.

meanings.sent1: His university offers a course on cinematographies for film enthusiasts.
meanings.sent2: Researchers delve into the history of cinematographies to uncover its evolution.
meanings.sent3: Studying cinematographies requires a keen eye for detail.
meanings.sent4: The professor's passion for cinematographies inspired his students to excel.
meanings.sent5: Through cinematographies, we explore the visual language of storytelling.
